qas.question: What percent of the Bronx is Hispanic and Latino Americans?
What percent of the Bronx is Puerto Rican?
What percent of the Bronx is Mexican?
What percent of the Bronx is Cuban?
What percent of the Bronx is Asian?

context: In 2009, Hispanic and Latino Americans represented <a0_0>52.0%<a0_0/> of the Bronx's population. Puerto Ricans represented <a1_0>23.2%<a1_0/> of the borough's population. Over 72,500 Mexicans lived in the Bronx, and they formed <a2_0>5.2%<a2_0/> of the population. Cubans numbered over 9,640 members and formed <a3_0>0.7%<a3_0/> of the population. In addition, over 319,000 people were of various Hispanic and Latino groups, such as Dominican, Salvadoran, and so on. These groups collectively represented 22.9% of the population. At the 2010 Census, 53.5% of Bronx's population was of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin (they may be of any race). Asian Americans are a small but sizable minority in the borough. Roughly 49,600 Asians make up <a4_0>3.6%<a4_0/> of the population. Roughly 13,600 Indians call the Bronx home, along with 9,800 Chinese, 6,540 Filipinos, 2,260 Vietnamese, 2,010 Koreans, and 1,100 Japanese.
